## Learn More About Visitor Management Software

## What Is Visitor Management Software?

  

Visitor management software, of VMS, keeps track of visitors entering an
establishment, whether it be a business, school, or public building. These
visitors include customers, delivery workers, job applicants, consultants,
inspectors, students, and anyone else entering a workplace that isn’t an
employee. Visitor management software automatically tracks and stores this
information electronically, with little to no work needed from the user’s
side.

  

VMS products allow an efficient and quick sign-in process for guests and can
easily gather their information, which is then transferred to a database.
These products can also help detect security threats by conducting background
checks during check-in and keeping track of where the guests are within the
facility. Once visitors are cleared, VMS applications can print name tags for
the guests, offer them directions, and alert employees that certain
individuals have arrived.

  

Visitor management applications are useful for hosting events or conferences
with a large number of people. Along with tracking and storing data, VMS tools
are capable of retaining information for returning guests. Visitor information
databases help businesses view a snapshot of their guest pool, as well as who
enters their facility daily. They can also be a more cost-effective solution
for tracking and monitoring guests.

  

### Visitor Management Software Features

  

Some of the most common features found across VMS applications include:

  

  * Alerts/Notifications

  * Accessible electronic log of all visitors

  * Background Checks

  * Badge management

  * Delivery tracking & acceptance

  * Electronic documents 

  * Guest/visitor database

  * ID scanning

  * ID badge printing

  * Pre-registration

  * Queue management 

  * Self-check-in/check-out

  * Signature capture for legal documents

  * Visitor photographing

  * Watch list

  
  

### Visitor Management Software Comparison

  

Before investing in visitor management software, consider the following key
factors:

  

  * **Hardware & accessories**: Depending on what you are using the software for, you may want added hardware such as a name tag printer, kiosk computers, or tablets. These extra accessories can be useful when expecting a high volume of visitors for meetings or events, especially when it comes to streamlining guest check-in. Therefore, the type of hardware and accessories a vendor offers should be taken into account. 

  

  * **Type of business** : Some VMS products are better-suited for a specific type of institution or industry. KeepnTrack, for example, is designed for schools and wouldn’t be the ideal selection for a corporate setting. Though some products are designed to accommodate every setting, it is best to research which products will work best for your specific industry. 

  
  

### Pricing Information

  

Some vendors, such as Envoy and iLobby, offer a free version of their product
with limited features and number of users. Basic plans can range from $20 to
$100 per month. Premium plans are the most expensive and typically cost over
$100 per month. However, they offer

Greater customization to fit the business’s needs.

  

Most VMS will offer either a free version or a free trial of their platform.
Make sure to take advantage of the free trial or version before deciding to
purchase a new VMS platform.

## Frequently Asked Questions

  * What does visitor management software do?
  * What are the benefits of using visitor management software?
  * How much does visitor management software cost?

### What does visitor management software do?

Visitor management software tracks everyone entering a building or office
whether they are customers, delivery workers, job applicants, consultants,
etc. The software does this by automatically capturing visitor information and
storing it in a database.

They can be deployed on a PC, tablet, or sometimes in a self-service kiosk.
Visitor management systems replace sign-in pen and paper tools and have the
major advantage that all data is stored in a database for easy retrieval if
necessary. They are also capable of printing name tags and scanning guest IDs.

### What are the benefits of using visitor management software?

Using a visitor management solution helps provide the following benefits:

  * Organizations can keep track of who is in their facility through a single database.
  * Visitors can self-check-in, which saves the business the time and overhead of hiring staff members to do this manually.
  * Background checks keep the facility secure and information is retained for future check-ins, which also saves time.
  * Provides a snapshot of the type of individuals entering a facility on either a daily basis or for events and meetings. 

### How much does visitor management software cost?

Some vendors, such as Envoy and iLobby, offer a limited free version of their
products. Basic plans go for around $20 to $100 a month. Premium plans usually
cost over $100 a month and are customized to fit the business’s needs.

## Privacy Preference Center

### Your Privacy

### Your Privacy

When you visit any website, the website and third parties may store or
retrieve information on your browser, mostly in the form of cookies. This
information might be about you, your preferences or your device. Because we
respect your right to privacy, you can choose not to allow some types of
cookies. Click on the different category headings to find out more and change
our default settings. However, blocking some types of cookies may impact your
experience of the site and the services we are able to offer. More information

  * ### Strictly Necessary Cookies

### Strictly Necessary Cookies

Always Active

Strictly Necessary Cookies

These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched
off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by
you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy
preferences, logging in or filling in forms. You may be able to set your
browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site
will not work if you block them. These cookies may be set by us or by third-
party providers.

Cookies Details‎

  * ### Performance Cookies

### Performance Cookies

Performance Cookies

These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure
and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are
the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site. If you
do not allow these cookies, it will be more difficult for us to know when you
have visited our site while not logged in, and we will not be able to fully
monitor its performance. These cookies may be set by us or by third-party
providers.

Cookies Details‎

  * ### Functional Cookies

### Functional Cookies

Functional Cookies

These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and
personalisation. They may be set by us or by third-party providers whose
services we have added to our pages. If you do not allow these cookies, then
some or all of these services may not function properly.

Cookies Details‎

  * ### Targeting Cookies

### Targeting Cookies

Targeting Cookies

These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners or by
companies whose products and services are featured on our site. They may be
used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you
relevant adverts elsewhere. They are based on uniquely identifying your
browser or internet device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will still
experience the same quantity of advertising, but it will be less relevant to
you.
